thread.title: Chelsea star Willian goes sight-seeing in London with wife ahead of Stoke clash
thread.title_full: Chelsea star Willian goes sight-seeing in London with wife ahead of Stoke clash

author: Liam Corless
title: Chelsea star Willian goes sight-seeing in London with wife ahead of Stoke clash
text:
Willian enjoyed the best of what London has to offer with his wife (Photo: Willian / Instagram / CameraSport via Getty Images) Share Get Chelsea FC updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Chelsea winger Willian did a bit of sight-seeing in London on Tuesday night as the Blues' focus turns to Saturday's trip to Stoke. 
The Brazilian speedster shared a picture of himself and wife Vanessa Martins below the London Eye with his 4.2million Instagram followers. 
Just 24 hours earlier Willian played a key role as Chelsea reached the FA Cup semi-finals courtesy of a last-eight win over Manchester United. 
A second-half N'Golo Kante strike settled the affair for the Premier League leaders as they edged through by a 1-0 scoreline. 
United played the majority of the match with 10 men after Ander Herrera was dismissed for two bookable offences after 35 minutes. The Blues star shared a picture of himself alongside his wife underneath the London Eye (Photo: Willian Borges Da Silva / Instagram) Chelsea beat United 24 hours earlier to reach the last four of the FA Cup (Photo: Darren Walsh) The game changed when Ander Herrera was sent off for United after 35 minutes (Photo: Getty Images Europe) 
Both cautions came after fouls on Eden Hazard, who came in for some rough treatment from United's players in the opening period. 
Hazard, Chelsea's star attacker, has returned to top form this season, leading to suggestions that he could be targeted by Real Madrid or Barcelona in the summer. 
And Blues striker Diego Costa is worried that Hazard could have his head turned by interest from the two Spanish giants. Eden Hazard came in for some rough treatment from United's players on Monday night (Photo: Rex Features) The Belgian has been back on song this term after a disappointing campaign last time out (Photo: Rex Features)
